TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed TextRenderingHint extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the quality of text rendering.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The quality ranges from text (fastest performance, but lowest quality) to antialiased text (better quality, but slower performance) to ClearType text (best quality on an LCD display).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.TextRenderingHint%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.TextContrast%2A> properties and the TextRenderingHint enumeration.
This example is designed to be used with Windows Forms. Paste the code into a form and call the `ChangeTextRenderingHintAndTextContrast` method when handling the form's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint AntiAlias = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Each character is drawn using its antialiased glyph bitmap without hinting. Better quality due to antialiasing. Stem width differences may be noticeable because hinting is turned off.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint AntiAliasGridFit = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Each character is drawn using its antialiased glyph bitmap with hinting. Much better quality due to antialiasing, but at a higher performance cost.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint ClearTypeGridFit = int32(5)

Docs.summary: Each character is drawn using its glyph ClearType bitmap with hinting. The highest quality setting. Used to take advantage of ClearType font features.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint SingleBitPerPixel = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Each character is drawn using its glyph bitmap. Hinting is not used.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint SingleBitPerPixelGridFit = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Each character is drawn using its glyph bitmap. Hinting is used to improve character appearance on stems and curvature.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Drawing.Text.TextRenderingHint SystemDefault = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Each character is drawn using its glyph bitmap, with the system default rendering hint. The text will be drawn using whatever font-smoothing settings the user has selected for the system.
